conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to follow the path of the liquid as shown by the arrows in the images.
The yellow liquid starts at point A.
The cyan liquid starts at point B.
The mint green liquid starts at point C.
The yellow liquid (from A) passes through the first baffle, which directs it towards container D.
The cyan liquid (from B) passes through the first baffle, which directs it towards container D.
The mint green liquid (from C) passes through the first baffle, which directs it towards container E.
The yellow liquid and the cyan liquid both flow into container D.
The mint green liquid flows into container E.
The yellow and cyan liquids will flow into container D, and the mint green liquid will flow into container E.
